PlantForm: Large upright shrub or small tree.
Stem: Green and smooth with milky sap, turning corrugated and corky beige with age.
Leaves: In opposite pairs 10-20 cm long, elliptical with heart shaped base, underside has hairs on midvein.
Flowers: Purple and white with 5 petals, waxy, in groups of up to 15.
FruitSeeds: Inflated pod 8-12 cm long, arranged in opposite pairs, rounded base with pointed tip, seeds have parachuting hairs.
Habitat: Cleared areas, roadsides, grazing land, savanna.
